Article.ArticleTitle: Making Research Matter More—Working with Action Research and Film in Sustainability Science

Author.Affiliation: Lund University Centre for Sustainability Studies (LUCSUS), Lund, Sweden. elina.andersson@lucsus.lu.se
Lund University Centre for Sustainability Studies (LUCSUS), Lund, Sweden. ann.akerman@lucsus.lu.se

Article.Abstract: Advocacy for both critical analysis of social and environmental change and a more solutions-oriented agenda has been a central mission of sustainability science since its inception [1]. To this end, integration of knowledge across disciplinary divides and inclusion of non-academic actors into the research process have been widely promoted (e.g. [2–4]). Aspirations to link knowledge to action do not only bear on processes of knowledge generation, but also on strategies for research outreach.
